pages.1_Load_data module

pages.1_Load_data.check_files(original_d_exists, cleaned_d_exists)[source]

Check if original and cleaned data files exist and load them.

Args:

original_d_exists (bool): Flag indicating if original data exists. cleaned_d_exists (bool): Flag indicating if cleaned data exists.

pages.1_Load_data.check_if_saved_models_exist()[source]

Check if saved models exist in the weights directory.

Returns:

bool: True if models exist, False otherwise.

pages.1_Load_data.import_data_to_session_state()[source]

Import cleaned data to Streamlit’s session state.

pages.1_Load_data.load_clean_data()[source]

Clean the original data.

Displays a spinner and messages indicating the process status.

pages.1_Load_data.load_original_data()[source]

Load original data from an SQL Database and export it.

Displays a spinner and messages indicating the process status.

pages.1_Load_data.main()[source]

Main function to run the Streamlit app.

pages.4_Neural_network module

pages.4_Neural_network.build_model(hp=None, X_train=None, units_1=None, units_2=None, learning_rate=None)[source]

Build the neural network model.

Args:

hp (HyperParameters, optional): Hyperparameters from Keras Tuner. Defaults to None. X_train (DataFrame, optional): Training data. Defaults to None. units_1 (int, optional): Number of units in the first layer. Defaults to None. units_2 (int, optional): Number of units in the second layer. Defaults to None. learning_rate (float, optional): Learning rate for the optimizer. Defaults to None.

Returns:

Sequential: The built model.

pages.4_Neural_network.load_model_weights(model_name)[source]

Load the model weights from an HDF5 file.

Args:

model_name (str): The name of the model to load.

Returns:

Sequential: The loaded model.

pages.4_Neural_network.load_training_history(filename)[source]

Load the training history from a JSON file.

Args:

filename (str): The name of the file to load the history from.

Returns:

dict: The training history.

pages.4_Neural_network.main()[source]

Main function to run the Streamlit app for neural network classifier.

pages.4_Neural_network.plot_results(history, X_test, y_test, model)[source]

Plot the training results and evaluation metrics.

Args:

history (dict): Training history. X_test (DataFrame): Test data. y_test (Series): Test labels. model (Sequential): The trained model.

pages.4_Neural_network.preprocess_data(df)[source]

Preprocess the input data.

Args:

df (DataFrame): The input data.

Returns:

tuple: Tuple containing training, validation, and test sets (X_train, X_val, X_test, y_train, y_val, y_test).

pages.4_Neural_network.save_model_weights(model, model_name, original_x_data)[source]

Save the trained model and feature names.

Args:

model (Sequential): The trained model. model_name (str): The name of the model. original_x_data (DataFrame): The original input data.

pages.4_Neural_network.save_training_history(history, filename)[source]

Save the training history to a JSON file.

Args:

history (History): The training history. filename (str): The name of the file to save the history.

pages.4_Neural_network.train_and_evaluate_model(X_train, y_train, X_val, y_val, X_test, y_test, units_1, units_2, learning_rate)[source]

Train and evaluate the model.

Args:

X_train (DataFrame): Training data. y_train (Series): Training labels. X_val (DataFrame): Validation data. y_val (Series): Validation labels. X_test (DataFrame): Test data. y_test (Series): Test labels. units_1 (int): Number of units in the first layer. units_2 (int): Number of units in the second layer. learning_rate (float): Learning rate for the optimizer.

Returns:

tuple: The trained model, training history, test loss, and test accuracy.

pages.4_Neural_network.tune_model(X_train, y_train, X_val, y_val, X_test, y_test)[source]

Perform hyperparameter tuning using Keras Tuner.

Args:

X_train (DataFrame): Training data. y_train (Series): Training labels. X_val (DataFrame): Validation data. y_val (Series): Validation labels. X_test (DataFrame): Test data. y_test (Series): Test labels.

Returns:

tuple: The best model, training history, test loss, and test accuracy.
